cu.rst.core.petrinet

Class PetriNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractGraph<V,E>
      • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractBaseGraph<V,E>
        • org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleDirectedGraph<PetriNetElementIntf,PetriNetEdge>
          • cu.rst.core.petrinet.PetriNet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, org.jgrapht.DirectedGraph<PetriNetElementIntf,PetriNetEdge>, org.jgrapht.Graph<PetriNetElementIntf,PetriNetEdge>

    public class PetriNet
extends org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleDirectedGraph<PetriNetElementIntf,PetriNetEdge>
    Author:
    partheinstein PetriNet is a directed graph which edges from place to sink and sink to place. A Petri Net is created as follows:
    PetriNet workflow = new PetriNet(new PetriNetEdgeFactory());
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public PetriNetEdge addEdge(PetriNetElementIntf src,

                   int tokens)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects two Petri Net elements.
        Parameters:
        src - Source element of the edge
        sink - Sink element of the edge
        tokens - Edge weight (typically it is 1.0)

        java.lang.Exception
